details.description: Electric (plug-in) cars and van grants. Which vehicles are eligible, how much the grants are worth and how to apply

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
You can get a grant towards the cost of each new electric (plug-in) car or van you buy, if it meets certain conditions. Grants are available for:

  • 25% off the cost of a car - maximum grant £5,000
  • 20% off the cost of a van - maximum grant £8,000

parts.title: What you'll get
parts.body: The grant covers up to a quarter of the cost of eligible electric (plug-in) cars, or a fifth of the cost for vans. The term ‘plug-in’ applies to any vehicle which can be charged by electricity.

parts.title: Eligibility
parts.body:
Your vehicle is likely to be eligible if it is one of the following:

  • electric vehicles (EVs) – these run completely on batteries and are plugged into the mains to be recharged
  • plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) – these use a petrol or diesel engine combined with a battery that plugs into the mains
  • hydrogen fuel cell vehicles and other technologies

Cars eligible for the grant

  • Chevrolet Volt
  • Citroen CZero
  • Mia Electric Mia
  • Mitsubishi iMiEV
  • Nissan Leaf
  • Peugeot iON
  • Renault Fluence
  • Smart fortwo electric drive
  • Toyota Prius Plug-in
  • Vauxhall Ampera

Vans eligible for the grant

  • Azure Dynamics Transit Connect Electric
  • Daimler Mercedes-Benz Vito E-Cell
  • Faam ECOMILE
  • Faam JOLLY 2000
  • Mia electric Mia U
  • Renault Kangoo
  • Smith Electric Smith Edison

parts.title: How to claim
parts.body: The amount of your grant will be automatically deducted from the price of your car or van when you buy it. The dealership will complete the paperwork, so there are no application forms for you to fill in, but you may be asked to complete a short questionnaire.
